newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur fuel up, low sulphur fuel soft.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur fuel up, low sulphur fuel soft.

text.p: NWE high sulphur fuel oil was steady to firmer on Wednesday amid strong bidding on the barge market, traders said.
High sulphur barges were traded at $89.50 and $90 a tonne fob ARA in the morning and then at $90.50, before the offer slipped back to around $90.
High sulphur cracked cargoes were notionally slightly firmer but fixed price talk was scarce. One regular seller said traders were bidding at around $2 over the high of published cif quotes.
Some players felt fixed prices should be around $84 cif NWE.
Others said this represented a differential with barge prices that was too large, and pegged prices closer to $86.

A Spanish refiner was heard to have bought an M-100 cargo from Klaipeda at around $6.50 over the mean/mean of published quotes. This follows the sale by a trader of another M-100 cargo on Monday at the same level.
Low sulphur markets were slightly softer amid a perception that Italian fuel oil buying would be muted for the time being.
Two or three prompt cargoes were thought available in NWE, and offers were talked at around $96 fob NWE.
